result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard S. Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard S. Olson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard S. Olson was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Richard S. Olson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Perform 80 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with Kristi E. Chadwick, unless otherwise permitted by the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard S. Olson

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brenda VanCuick.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.     Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  As a condition he is ordered to complete 80 hours of community service.  Courts costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision and if any unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 2 and 3 - Pleas of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing adj. until after SEHR in another case in Br. 4.  Sentencing 3/23/16 at 9:30.  Bond continued.
for Substitution of Counsel.  Atty Brenda VanCuick substituted for Atty David Celebre as attorney for the defendant.

David Celebre  kmk

Defendant Richard S. Olson appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  ST called witness KSD Deputy Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Celebre. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
